title: VF Corp ups guidance on "strong" Q2
text:
Gross margin down 10 bps Sales climb 4.6% 
VF Corp's sales growth was driven by the group's outdoor & action sports and jeanswear coalition 
US apparel giant VF Corp has reported &quotstrong" second-quarter earnings and sales growth, raising its profit guidance for the full year. 
In the three months to the end of June, earnings were up 8.3% to US$170.8m from $157.7m a year earlier. 
Gross margin was down ten basis points to 48.3% on a reported basis, but in line with company expectations. VF Corp said a continued benefit from the shift of its revenue mix toward higher margin businesses was more than offset by the impact of foreign currency. 
Revenue rose 4.6% on a reported basis driven by growth in the group's outdoor & action sports and jeanswear coalitions, as well as its international and direct-to-consumer businesses. 
International revenue, on a reported basis, was down 1% in the quarter. In Europe, sales were down 8% reported, and in the Asia Pacific region climbed 14%. Revenue in the Americas (non-US) region was down 1%. 
&quotOur second quarter was another strong illustration of the ability of our global, diverse and powerful brands and platforms to deliver consistent, profitable growth," said CEO Eric Wiseman. &quotOur strategy for continued growth and fuelling our momentum is working: Keep the consumer at the centre of everything we do; deliver innovative and relevant product; and focus our execution and discipline to maximize long-term growth opportunities." 
For the full-year, VF is forecasting EPS, on a currency neutral basis, to increase 15% compared to an adjusted EPS of $3.08 in 2014. This is an increase from the previous expectation of 14% per share growth provided in May. 
Full-year revenue expectations are unchanged, with an 8% increase on a currency neutral basis, and a 3% rise on a reported basis.
